Articles.Content:
Lord Strange, wealthy philanthropist, arms dealer, politician, social butterfly, most litigious man in Kerbal history, has begun his own space program, after his disappointment with the failure of the government to stay away from territorial grabbing, name-calling, and nuking. Having bought up much of the stock of the cheapest finest aerospace companies in the land, his company has established itself as one of the premier Rocket builders and contractors in the land!

The design philosophy of LSPEPE is to ensure that rockets look good, yet are pilotable by the most incapable Kerbals.

Soon to be revealed in all their glory, the following rockets and spaceplanes!

(pictures will come soon)

The Slimline LKO Satellite Launcher, Echo Mk.2

The Magnificent Munar Probe Launcher, Prometheus Mk.1, lifting the Narcissus 3 probe towards its rendezvous with the Mun.

(Narcissus 1 and 2 were lost due to lithobraking)

The Perfect Munar Module Launcher, Cronus Mk.1, lifting the Patroclus Mk.2 Module towards the Mun, and history!

(Patroclus Mk.1 was lost with all the crew due to unspecified landing problems, possibly caused by forgetting to attach any legs)

The Enourmous Munar Base Launcher, Cronus Mk. 2, lifting Mun Base Argo Mk. 2 towards it\'s resting place in on of the Mare. Comes complete with return module!
It feels like you are trying to make an ordinary rocket look amazing in some way...
Says the man who uses photoshop filters on all his pics

Says the man who uses photoshop filters on all his pics

Yes, but those have great detail and the least amount of generic influence.

Yes, but those have great detail and the least amount of generic influence.

Yeah, that pic isn\'t great, that\'s the smallest of the rockets, and generally my rockets are not the most amazing constructions - I aim for sleekness and ease of use at the moment. I\'ll hopefully update with better and more pictures tomorrow.

OK, better pictures of the Echo up, and stupid spelling mistakes corrected.

Constructive criticisms of designs appreciated.

Have you thought about prettying up that gray bit in the middle? That I think would be a great improvement.

Oh, and on the first picture, use white instead of black. It will make it it much easier to read.

Have you thought about prettying up that gray bit in the middle? That I think would be a great improvement.

Oh, and on the first picture, use white instead of black. It will make it it much easier to read.

Or red.

Or red.

Depends on the shade really.

Have you thought about prettying up that gray bit in the middle? That I think would be a great improvement.

Oh, and on the first picture, use white instead of black. It will make it it much easier to read.

Yeah, I\'ll sort out the SAS module.

As for the colours on the first picture, any other colours really don\'t work, or at least look a bit tacky to me. I\'m going to stick with the grey.
Nice budget lifter you have there.

Does it carry the Kerboy Channel?

Only for subscribers
